replies.msg: 個圖好基

Fabio Caressa who, during the course of the Club Sky Sport broadcast, made some notes on Gattuso's decision to continue to focus on the Spanish winger: «Suso slows down the maneuver but not only - explains Caressa - also Piatek. It is very difficult for a striker to always take the advantage on the defender if the cross arrives after 3-4 fakes, always the same. Suso's way of playing at the moment does not seem to be suitable for Milan ».

Paolo Di Canio also added: «Piatek is very good at reading the trajectories and should be served first, immediately so as not to give the defense time to contain him. Does Suso always do the same action? Yes, but the worst thing is that he always crosses with the left ". Perhaps for the first time the Milan fans agree with what was said by the former director of SkySport24, who has always been guilty - according to some supporters of the Devil - of leveling too many unjustified criticisms against Milan.



When Suso is in good form, the 3-4 fakes are not such a big issue since they can put him in either a good position to cross or in a position to score himself. Right now though, he is unable to score and his fakes are very ineffective. He loses time and when he does manage to send a cross in, all the defenders are already perfectly positioned.

When was the last time Suso had an assist? Surely it was before the break. Also, it's not surprising that none of Piatek's goal have come from a pass from Suso.

Hakan, on the other hand, seems to be getting over his funk. Many of Piatek's goals have come from his assists or plays initiated by him.

終於唔係我地有別於其他地方球員 Skysport 講波佬都講咗個拖慢個問題

Ata raportuan se Milan mund të përpiqet të zvogëlojë koston prej 70 milionë eurosh duke e futur në marrëveshje Patrick Cutrone si një lojtarë icili vlerësohet 30 milion €, por edhe duke shtuar një shumë të hollash.

They reported that Milan could try to reduce the cost of 70 million euros by putting Patrick Cutrone in the deal as a player worth € 30 million but also adding a lot of money.

Secondo quanto riferisce Claudio Raimondi a SportMediaset, dopo il derby perso, Rino Gattuso starebbe ragionando su eventuali correttivi nella sua squadra: la difesa ha incassato tre gol contro l'Inter e per questo, se dovessero servire forze fresche, ci sono pronti Conti, Zapata e anche Caldara, che ormai ha pienamente recuperato dal grave infortunio che lo ha tenuto fuori per diversi mesi. La problematica principale resta però come servire nel migliore dei modi Piatek, troppo isolato nel derby: Gattuso non vorrebbe cambiare il suo 4-3-3, ma è chiaro che è lecito aspettarsi molto di più sia da Calhanoglu che da Suso. Lo spagnolo non è stato convocato dalla Spagna e resterà quindi a Milanello a lavorare, ma dietro di lui il suo connazionale Castillejo è in pressing. Il turco, dopo una piccola ripresa, è tornato a fornire prestazioni altalenanti. L'idea dell'allenatore rossonero potrebbe quindi essere quella di liberare la fantasia di Paquetà, arretrando Calhanoglu a metà campo e avvicinando il brasiliano a Piatek. Questa potrebbe essere l'uniche variabile per mantenere il 4-3-3, ma negli ultimi giorni starebbe crescendo anche il partito che vorrebbe Cutrone subito in campo: la tentazione porta al 4-3-1-2 con Paquetà trequartista puro, Biglia davanti alla difesa e Bakayoko da mezzala al posto di Kessie.


傳撚撚試4312
Piatek 告仔雙前鋒
Paqueta AMC

replies.msg:
其實防中定義對米蘭球迷嚟講都幾值得討論
而家無波打住想同大家討論吓
大家將加度素係咪定義為防守中場？派路又係咪防守中場？
大部分街外球迷
都會將加度素定義為世界上其中一個最強防守中場
我自己對防守中場一向嘅定義係
位置上係企喺中場中間，做防線前嘅第一度屏障
加度素單對單防守力係強，有好強破壞力
但佢有好多缺點，例如技術，視野，轉守為攻等等
所以放佢喺影響力無咁大嘅右中場
負責幫派路手搞破壞，搶到波就交比派路
就算派路缺陣，通常中場中間呢個位都係岩布仙尼補上
所以我自己就會將加度素定為右中場
佢係世界級防守球員，唔係世界級防守中場
你可以放佢打防守中場果個位，但唔會係世界級

派路係咪防守中場，N年前響米蘭論壇都討論咗好多次
有人會覺得派路唔係防守中場，因為佢防守力好差
佢能力最強係長傳，派牌，控制節奏等
所以有人話佢係墮後中場
亦有人話佢打嘅位置係球壇新位置「後腰」（其實係煌語，本意都係防守中場）
我自己就覺得，加度素係右中場，派路係防守中場
我主要係由位置上去𠝹定，唔係功能
同埋位置只係戰術上將11個球員佈置喺邊個位到
只係一個稱呼，球員係生，唔同類型球員放唔同位置會有唔同效果
唔洗因個別球員特性而特別諗個新朵比佢（我聽過防守前鋒..）
即係例如佐真奴有佢用處
佢打到好多位，但沙利就係將佢放咗喺防守中場位置
所以佢喺車路士就係防守中場
想睇下大家諗法，大家討論吓
（sor又打咗咁多字）

主要都係睇分工企位 每個人睇嘅區域
大家落過落都知打機同你現實冇上帝視覺係有好大出入
我個人會偏向用分工去睇先

佢要做嘅就係係中場橫向防守 搶咗波就最快速度比返附近嘅隊友
而派路企中間係方便其他隊友可以好快咁搵到佢再等佢發牌 同埋相信係視野問題 , 係中間睇到嘅野可能更有利派路睇更多 ,同時放佢企後啲唔需要佢花太多嘅功夫係同對方防守球員糾纏 , 另一樣 其實派路防守係唔差
岩布打中間又另一種風格 做到中路大閘嘅屬性 防空同加埋撚撚組織起一個中場攔截強度 即有時肥安叫佢衝埋入禁區爭頂 但果有段時間岩布傷太多

但肥安個聖誕樹係好特製嘅一個陣基本不可複製只有果時嘅米蘭可以用到 叫就叫4321 但出到黎其實係一個斜埋一邊嘅陣

另一面講返而家米蘭 有Baka 其實係中場提供咗一個可靠嘅防守 從而去起一個正常嘅防守框架
起碼唔會比人中路放題先
米蘭其中一個大問題係 防守成功後嘅守轉攻點樣傳返個波上去
好多時兩翼(suso同克勤) 都縮到好深咁去幫手由自己個半場傳波上去
留意下其他隊好多時都唔需要差唔多10個球員縮晒係半場搞一輪都傳唔到波上去
原來有路爾斯加西亞

Milan to keep Bakayoko?
Milan have reportedly decided to pay the €35m necessary to turn Tiemoue Bakayoko’s loan from Chelsea permanent this summer.

According to Gazzetta dello Sport, Bakayoko has ‘succeeded’ in winning over Milan boss Gennaro Gattuso.

Consequently there is an ‘increasing’ expectation of the deal going through, although it could be funded by the possible sale of Franck Kessie.

The newspaper writes Gattuso will meet Kessie on Thursday for ‘face-to-face’ talks, where the Ivorian is likely to be handed a ‘heavier’ fine than Lucas Biglia after their Derby d’Italia spat.

That would be because the Rossoneri are ‘angrier’ with the former Atalanta man than Biglia, with La Gazzetta essentially corroborating Tuttomercatoweb’s report from last week.

Consequently there is an ‘increasing’ expectation of the deal going through, although it could be funded by the possible sale of Franck Kessie.

The newspaper writes Gattuso will meet Kessie on Thursday for ‘face-to-face’ talks, where the Ivorian is likely to be handed a ‘heavier’ fine than Lucas Biglia after their Derby d’Italia spat.

That would be because the Rossoneri are ‘angrier’ with the former Atalanta man than Biglia, with La Gazzetta essentially corroborating Tuttomercatoweb’s report from last week.

Serie A giants AC Milan are reportedly keeping a close eye on Brazilian youngster Reiner, who is considered to be a heir to Lucas Paqueta.

We understand that the Brazilian Under-17 starlet is someone that the rossoneri are observing with a keen interest and his playing style is very similar to that of Paqueta.

Two Argentine talents in Juan Sebastian Sforza and Matias Palacios have been proposed by intermediaries to Milan. Both are eyed by Juventus and Genoa respectively and are considered to be upcoming stars of the South American game.
Another South American starlet that Milan are keeping eyes on is Juan Gutierrez, who is considered to be the 'next Lautaro Martinez' by many. He has already made a debut in the Copa Libertadores for his club Danubio.

The rossoneri still see South America as their base for upcoming talents and they will likely make moves for many youngsters.

'Paqueta & Piatek no Kaka or Sheva'
Ex-Milan star Rui Costa is impressed with Lucas Paqueta and Krzysztof Piatek but insists they are not the new Kaka and Andriy Shevchenko.

Rui Costa now works as a sporting director for Benfica, and the former Portugal midfielder admits he tried to sign Paqueta before his move to Milan.

“I followed Paqueta in Brazil,” he told Gazzetta dello Sport.

“Given the job I do, I know him well. He has great quality. I wanted to bring him to Benfica, but I couldn’t sign him: he was too expensive for a Portuguese club.

“He has quality and age on his side to grow and develop in a difficult League like the Italian one.

“He’ll be himself, as he should be. Kaka was a No 10, but he also had power that I’ve rarely seen in a No 10 and may never see again.

“He was out of the ordinary. He was Kaka. And Paqueta is Paqueta: I’ve seen him play as a central midfielder.

“Technically he’s very strong. He has a wonderful, velvety left foot.”

The 46-year-old was then asked about the other January arrival at San Siro...

“I know him less than Paqueta, but needless to say he’s a great striker,” he continued.

“I was surprised by his adaptability: he only spent a few months at Genoa but scored so many goals.

“It would’ve been easy to say that Milan, a unique club with unique history and huge pressure, was a complicated move for him or, at least, he needed time.

“Instead, it’s been nothing like that: he came in and has scored a lot, even in important games.

“It seems like he’s been there for a lifetime. He’s been impressive. But even in this case, making comparisons is useless.

“Piatek isn’t Sheva or anyone else, but he’s brought different solutions to Milan’s attack and solved many problems.

“I was lucky enough to play with great strikers and I can say that playing with them calms your nerves.

“You knew that in Sheva, Kaka or Inzaghi, you had teammates who, sooner or later, would settle a game because one of them would score.

“Piatek isn’t Sheva or Inzaghi, but he scores goals and solves problems.”

Gattuso: Future for another time
Milan boss Gennaro Gattuso has refused to discuss what his future holds. “In two months I’ll say what I really think…”

Gattuso has led Milan to the cusp of a return to the Champions League ahead of Saturday’s trip to Sampdoria in Serie A, but the Coach preferred to focus on how side overcame the ‘blow’ of their derby defeat to Inter.

“Today isn’t the club’s priority, neither am I thinking about my future or the two years I have left on my contract,” he said at a Press conference.

“I’m only thinking about achieving an objective that is crucial for the club, lads and my own growth.

“In two months I’ll say what I really think. For now I’m only focused on my work and bringing Milan back where they deserve to be.

“The derby was a blow, a defeat that burned, but we must look ahead. We’re in first place for our Scudetto.

“At the start of the season we said that the Champions League was our scudetto. There are 10 games left and we’re up there.

“I thought Inter were coming from a bad run of form, so I was the one who prepared for the game in a certain way.

“We tried to press a bit higher, but maybe I wasn’t good enough and the team were a bit low-cut

I made the mistake of presumption. I thought about doing something different, but now it’s important to understand where we went wrong and keep doing what we do best.

“We’ve suffered so much, it’s been two weeks of so much bitterness, but we trained well.”

Gattuso was then asked about the row between Franck Kessie and Lucas Biglia during the Derby della Madonnina.

“I met Kessie yesterday,” he explained.

“I don’t hold grudges. I’m not angry, there’s disappointment on my part but it’s finished now.

“My players know they can dribble with my heart, but respect is needed for everyone. The club acted impeccably.

“During my playing career, I was wrong more than once and I’ve always paid for it dearly. I’ve always shown my face and assumed my responsibilities, while the club have always let me feel their weight.”

Finally, the former Italy midfielder had his say on the Rossoneri’s plans to replace San Siro.

“San Siro is the heart. When you step foot here, you can smell the history.

“For me it was a dream to play there, but to be at the top, in modern football, something extra is needed and Juve have taught us that.

“It’s a great stadium where so many great games have been played, but we need to understand the needs of a club who want to go back to competing with teams who have stadiums, money, merchandising, better TV rights.

“It’s right that the club are thinking about doing something different.”
